result.execSummary:
The defendant Javon R. McCaston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Court ordered the Dosage Probation Program.

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges, DNA surcharge. To be paid over period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Provide a DNA sample, pay DNA surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Comply with the standard rules of probation.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment.  Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Submit to random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: Release privileges for employment and treatment purposes only.  Good time credit.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Javon R. McCaston

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Dosage Probation Approved.

Defendant Javon R. McCaston in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  Defendant Javon R. McCaston in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the state, defense counsel and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 1 YEAR at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, concurrent to case# 13CF3576. 
Credit for 64 days time served. 

COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 years under the supervision of Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AS TO COUNT 1: 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation.
* SERVE 60 DAYS "condition time" at the House of Correction with release privileges for employment and treatment purposes only.  Court ordered "GOOD TIME CREDIT" for the condition time.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered the Dosage Probation Program.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal Rights given.

  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.

Defendant Javon R. McCaston in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  Defendant Javon R. McCaston in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Court INCREASED bail by $200.00 for a total cash bail amount of $450.00 with TURNOVER TO Justice Point Pretrial Services for supervision to continue.  Conditions of release remain the same as previously ordered.

- NO FILE IN COURT -
Defendant Javon R. McCaston NOT in court; in custody.  Attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel appeared on behalf of the defendant.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court ordered the outstanding bench warrant WITHDRAWN.

Court addressed bail:  Arguments heard.  Court INCREASED bail by $200.00 for a total cash bail amount of $450.00 with TURNOVER TO Justice Point Pretrial Services for supervision to continue.  Conditions of release remain the same as previously ordered.

Case adjourned to 06-25-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Justice Point Discharge Summary, received and filed
*case in warrant status*
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report; received and filed.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel in court.  Holly L. Bunch for David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties unable to proceed with a Plea and Sentencing Hearing today.
Defendant does NOT appear.
Atty. Salzwadel advised the Court that she received a phone call this morning from the defendant's mother who stated that the defendant left for Chicago for a death in the family.
Statements made.
Court ordered a bench warrant to issue.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

**No bail forfeited.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services "Violation" Report; received and filed.

ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Court contacted regarding Justice Point Violation.  Defendant absconded prior to case being heard.  Clerk advised by Justice Point the violation will be addressed on the next court date before Judge Donald.  This clerk contacted Judge Donald's clerk and is advised they will address the violation on the next date and we should not issue a warrant.  Copy of email placed in the court file.

Defendant Javon R. McCaston in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties unable to proceed with a Plea and Sentencing Hearing today.
Judge Donald is currently in trial on an unrelated matter.
Case adjourned to 05-18-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Plea and Sentencing Hearing.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed. tk

Defendant Javon R. McCaston in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised Per ADA Robles this case is reassigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Oral No Contact Order with JAMES B., KENESHA B., TAMRA E., ABDUL E., KELSEY G., MARKESHA F., BENJAMIN G., ADRIAN G., VALERIE J., KIMBERLY J., CANDICE K., REGINALD M., BRENDA M., SAMSON M., IVY N., LILLIE P., CHRISTOPHER R., LAMONT W., JASON W., RENEE W. AND RENISCHA W.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Javon R. McCaston in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Javon R. McCaston in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
